name: Can't stand + V-ing
meaning: To not be able to suffer/tolerant something
examples: I can't stand looking at drowsy people in my office

name: Can't help + V-ing
meaning: To not be able to control/stop/change something
examples: I can't help thinking about the prestigious/reputable achievement

name: Work out
meaning: To train the body by physical exercise
examples: Working out at a gym or swim twice a week is necessary for me
He has many health issues so he choose to work out every day

name: Wear out
meaning: To make yourself/somebody feel very tired
examples: The past few days had really worn him out
We extremely wore out because newcomers didn't integrate with our working tradition

name: Drop off
meaning: To fall into a light sleep
examples: I dropped off and missed the end of the movie

name: Get round to
meaning: To find the time to do something
examples: It takes hours and hours just to get round to do this work

name: Pile on
meaning: (Espectically for a person's weight) to increase quickly
examples: If you don't want to pile on, don't sleep abnormally

name: Wake something up
meaning: To become conscious after sleeping
examples: Please wake me up, I can never hear the alarm when it goes off

name: A clause + as a result of + something
meaning: A thing is a result of something
examples: Her arm was pain as a result of burdening on the arms
The flight was delayed as a result of thick fog

name: Be in control (of sth)
meaning: To direct or manage an organization, an area or a situation
examples: Who's in control of this place?
The attendants were instructed to be in control of their patient at all times

name: Lead from the front
meaning: To take an active part in what you're are telling or persuading others to do
examples: If I were in your position, I'd lead from the front in this business to get the best possible results

name: Take the trouble + to V-inf
meaning: Not afraid to do anything hard
examples: You'll become a more successful person if you take the trouble to carry out whatever is needed

name: Break your back
meaning: If you work extremely hard, or put a lot of effort into achieving something, you break your back to do it
examples: Parents always break the back for their children to go to school

name: Boil the ocean
meaning: To waste time on a task or project that is unnecessary, not worth doing or impossible to achieve
examples: Don't try to boil the ocean with your first version of a product
You recommend that you shouldn't boil the ocean to pay attention the poor markets

name: Be lost for words
meaning: To be so surprised, confused that you don't know what to say
examples: He was lost for words when he opened the package

name: Insist on/upon doing something
meaning: To keep doing something, even if it annoys other people, or people think it's not good for you
examples: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated

name: Help out
meaning: To help somebody, especially in a difficult situation
examples: Staff members always oughta be ready to help out new employees and explain the office procedures

name: Sort (something/somebody) out
meaning: To deal with somebody's/your own problems successfully
examples: If you can wait a moment, I'll sort it all out for you

name: Pull your weight
meaning: To work hard as other people in a group
examples: The others had complained that she wasn't pulling her weight

name: Spread yourself too thin
meaning: To try to do too many things at the same time, so that you cannot give enough time or attention to any of them
examples: I'd been spreading myself too thin so I resigned as a waiter of the restaurant

name: Get on
meaning: To continue speaking, often after a short pause
examples: If you get on like this, you won't have any relatives left at all

name: Get into something
meaning: To become interested in something
examples: You feel shy when you start your speech, but then you get into it

name: S + play + a vital/important role + in something
meaning: Something/somebody that plays an important person in something
examples: Making eye contact plays a vital role in demonstrating genuine an interest in the person
Nutrition plays a tremendously important role in nurturing your physical health

name: Needless to say
meaning: It doesn't need to be said, what you're about to say is obvious and to be expected in the circumstances
examples: Needless to say, We're on a very tight budget

name: Do something over
meaning: To do something again
examples: He wants me to do what I've said
To absorb what you've learned you oughta do them over frequently

name: Do away with something
meaning: (informal) to stop/avoid doing or having something; to make something end
examples: It's high time the government did away with all of these old tax records

name: Break through something
meaning: To force yourself through something that's holding you back
examples: I have broken through shyness of myself and become more sociable and amicable

name: Phase something out
meaning: To stop using something gradually in stages over a period of time
examples: We'd better phase the outdated methods out to create a more efficient one

name: Give off something (emit)
meaning: To produce something such as a smell, heat, light
examples: The police stopped the van because it was giving off a lot of black smoke

name: S1 + wish + S2 + would/could + V
meaning: Wish to do something
examples: I wished I could organise a volunteer group to help out the poor
